description: Nikola Petrak, prompted by requests from free zone organizers and memories of Alex's advocacy, authorizes release of Halden’s spiral override, granting councils power to locally alter BCI scoring logic.
Free zone councils move quickly, modifying scoring rules to erase certain BCI penalties and reward historic dissent. Some neighborhoods celebrate, others express unease over possible local abuses.
Dramatic stories emerge of individuals suddenly gaining or losing job access, housing, or medical priority due to new local scoring standards. Debates ignite over what justice means in each district.
Citywide meetings intensify as some advocate abolishing BCI entirely, while others cling to their locally adapted systems, heightening tensions between districts.
In a closed session, Oksana Lintz and Nikola Petrak debate the spiral override’s impacts, acknowledging both genuine community healing and the risk of escalating group conflicts.
